page.title: 08Elm Park - Age Concern Home
page.content: On the 21st of{July 1982 Elm Park} {Short-stay Holiday Home}took over a childrens home. The private company is under the direction of{Age Concern. } 25 non-residential staff look after the 23 residents.One officer is on duty at night. There are{12 permanent}retired people in residence and{12 short stay} holiday places.The cost is Â£135 per week but the DHSS help people who cannot afford to pay. Some of the residents are disabled. Different organisations i.e.Church,Guides,Brownies etc.visit the residents to entertain them. A{Private Home for the Elderly}(one of many now being established) has been opened in{Martells Hall,} mentioned in original{DOMESDAY BOOK,} was held by{GEOFFREY De MANDERVILLE. } { }
